```{r}
#| echo: false

default_chunk_hook  <- knitr::knit_hooks$get("chunk")

latex_font_size <- c("Huge", "huge", "LARGE", "Large", 
                     "large", "normalsize", "small", 
                     "footnotesize", "scriptsize", "tiny")

knitr::knit_hooks$set(chunk = function(x, options) {
  x <- default_chunk_hook(x, options)
  if(options$size %in% latex_font_size) {
    paste0("\n \\", options$size, "\n\n", 
      x, 
      "\n\n \\normalsize"
    )
  } else {
    x
  }
})

```

# Ingredients

Grocery List
```{r}
#| echo: false
#| results: 'asis'
dinner.recipes <- dinner[sample(x=1:length(dinner), size=3, replace = TRUE)] # Select dinner recipes
breakfast.recipe <- breakfasts[sample(x=1:length(breakfasts), size=1, replace = TRUE)] # Select breakfast recipes
recipe <- c(breakfast.recipe, dinner.recipes[1], dinner.recipes[2], dinner.recipes[3])             # Create a list to store the recipe


library(package = "rvest")
for (i in 1:4){
   recipe.item <- read_html(recipe[i])
   ingredients.section <- html_element(recipe.item, "#ingredients")
   ingredients <- html_elements(ingredients.section, "li")
   formatted_list <- paste("-", html_text(ingredients))
   cat(formatted_list, sep = "\n")
} # Find the ingredients for each recipe

```

# Recipe One
```{r}
#| echo: false
#| results: 'asis'
image <- function(recipenumber){
recipe.one <- read_html(recipe[recipenumber])
image.element <- html_element(recipe.one, ".figure-img")
image.url <- paste("website/", html_attr(image.element,"src"), sep = "")
# width="50%" shrinks the image for printing
recipe.title <- recipe.one |> html_element("h1") |> html_text()
cat(paste('![', recipe.title, '](', image.url, "){width=50%}", sep="")) 
} # Create a function to load the figure of the recipe
image(2)
```

**Ingredients**
```{r}

#| results: 'asis'
ingredients <- function(recipenumber){
recipe.one <- read_html(recipe[recipenumber])
ingredients.section <- html_element(recipe.one, "#ingredients")
ingredients <- html_elements(ingredients.section, "li")
ormatted_list <- paste("-", html_text(ingredients))

} # Create a function to load the ingredients of the recipe
```

**Instructions**
```{r}
#| echo: false
#| results: 'asis'
instructions <- function(recipenumber){
recipe.one <- read_html(recipe[recipenumber])
instructions.section <- html_element(recipe.one, "#instructions")
instructions <- html_elements(instructions.section, "li")
formatted_list <- paste("1.", html_text(instructions))
cat(formatted_list, sep = "\n")
} # Create a function to load the instructions of the recipe
instructions(2)
```
